abstract: Citigroup finally announced the results of what analysts expected to be an “ugly” quarter. The banking giant reported its fourth-straight quarterly loss – $2.8 billion – and took $13.2 billion in write-downs.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup finally announced the results of what analysts expected to be an “ugly” quarter. The banking giant reported its fourth-straight quarterly loss – $2.8 billion – and took $13.2 billion in write-downs.

headline.main: Despite Bad News, Citigroup Looks to Go Shopping
